title: Are we ever getting a lore Q&A on the boards?
body: All of these reddit ones are triggering me.

Does Camille have sheaths for her blades or prosthetic legs for when she's doesn't need them? How big and populace is Piltover/Zaun and the surrounding counties? Is it the size of NY, Tokyo etc?

I'm afraid other than the map, I'm not the expert on these sorts of things, but I can fairly confidently say that both Piltover and Zaun have populations greater than could normally be supported by the territory around them, due to the influx of wealth and goods from trade.  They're less like your typical historical city, surrounded by _massive_ amounts of farmland - they effectively outsource most of that sort of thing.  I don't have a good handle on the relative population totals, sorry.

I personally can't share the names for all the seas (and as Gangplank states, there's an awful lot of them) but far to the East of Piltover, just North of Bilgewater, is where the Guardian's Sea hangs out these days.

I hope that helps - turns out I'm not very useful in this thread after all :(

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GhktKEe7,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-15T21:18:10.341+0000)
>
> ... turns out I'm not very useful in this thread after all :(

I don't fault you for trying.  It's more than the Narrative team seems to want to do on their own boards.

For the record, I'm sick and tired of seeing all those (alleged) AMAs on Reddit where they only answer softball questions and never really address anything significant, like how they plan on addressing their communication failures here and now they have to wait for special events to update content when we were told that wasn't a necessity.

I'm just waiting for the moment when Warwick's rework is released and all that region's lore gets updated for Jaredan to tell us that the new lore doesn't need to be tied to an event.

So, you have a valid point, and I'd like to ask about your last statement.

It seems to me, that when stories and lore updates are released on something like the Piltover micro site, there's a lot of disappointment that it's not part of a bigger, all singing, all dancing, event of the scale of Burning Tides or more.  (I miss Burning Tides, myself, too.)

When you say you'd rather content was updated unconnected to special events, do you mean more like it's a random Tuesday, and unconnected to anything else, a story drops?  When Universe went live and we found a few more champ stories (like the sad Ekko one) was that more what you were after?

Can you elaborate, if you're not fed up doing so, ofc.

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GhktKEe7,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-15T21:41:18.671+0000)
>
> 
> Can you elaborate, if you're not fed up doing so, ofc.

I'd be glad to, if you don't mind my chopping up your quote to address certain points.

> It seems to me, that when stories and lore updates are released on something like the Piltover micro site, there's a lot of disappointment that it's not part of a bigger, all singing, all dancing, event of the scale of Burning Tides or more.  (I miss Burning Tides, myself, too.)

Burning Tides was **special**:  It was the first set of significant new lore since the Freljord Patch of 2013 and the big RetCon in 2014 (which is another issue entirely), the start of the bromance between Graves and Twisted Fate, Gangplank's "rework" and MF's change from "shameless flirt" to "hardcore b----," a fleshed out Bilgewater (which still lacks a real map) the Black Market Brawlers ARAM mode, etc.

Not every release that includes new lore can be that extensive and epic, which makes it a bit disappointing.  Then again, not everything at Riot can syncopate that well every time (or ever again, lol).

> When you say you'd rather content was updated unconnected to special events, do you mean more like it's a random Tuesday, and unconnected to anything else, a story drops?  

I wish the cadence for these story releases wasn't wholly tied into new incoming content or some special event.

For example:

* The first Shurima update was for Azir and the second was for Taliyah.
* "Burning Tides" was built around the second Gangplank rework.
* "Mt. Targon" was made around the Taric rework and Aurelion Sol's release.
* The most recent updates to the Shadow Isles happened around Yorick's rework.
* This Piltover event was fabricated on the release of Camille.

As I said earlier, I fully expect a huge lore update for Zaun when Warwick's rework is finished and for Demacia when Galio is ready.  That's really annoying, especially when we were told by Narrative that new content wouldn't be tied to new content.

> When Universe went live and we found a few more champ stories (like the sad Ekko one) was that more what you were after?

No.  Once again, the release of that new content required a tie-in event (Universe going live) and led to another softball-filled Reddit AMA (and not on these boards) that didn't attempt to answer any of the tough questions that has plagued this Narrative team since the Freljord patch (which had a different Narrative Lead) and the RetCon (which had another Narrative Lead).

It would be nice if new stories could be released when they're ready and not require a tie-in to some upcoming release and if the Rioters in Narrative would unclench their hindquarters and have _meaningful_ communication with their fans on THESE boards and not on Reddit..

Hope this elaboration helps, but I really doubt if anyone within Narrative and Foundations will actually **want **to do anything to address them.  :)

So many questions, and so few I can help with.  Sorry :(  I'll answer where I can.

> [{quoted}](name=Chromatic Eagle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GhktKEe7,comment-id=00010003,timestamp=2016-12-09T22:10:07.412+0000)
>
> I had Camille questions but I forgot.
> 
> ...How often do Zaunites interact with Piltover?

Some Zaunites never leave their neighborhood, and eventually some Zaunites become so adapted that they can't leave Zaun.  However, there's a healthy amount of interaction between the two, especially at the areas where they are closest.  The deeper into Zaun you get, the stranger it would be to see a Piltie, though.

> ...How is constructing an artificial heart more difficult than a brain, and does Orianna predate Camille?

Hearts occupy a special position in Runeterra - it's a more poetic or symbolic take in a way.  I know that doesn't make much sense to us, but you can think of the brain as the source of decisions, the heart is the power source.  Really important power source.

> ...How close is Zaun to Piltover? Apparently people can run or walk from one city to the other in a few minutes or hours.

Very close, but they're both pretty big cities.  So there are places on the outer edges of both cities that would take many hours to get to the other side, but at their closest points, they're pretty much overlapping.

> ...Besides Camille's family, are there other notable clans that we'll see?

Well, we've heard of the Medarda clan (mentioned in the Progress Day story, and Jago Medarda is the owner of the Medarda Heirloom map).

> Why hasn't Noxus invaded Piltover like it has Ionia and maybe Demacia? Do Noxians still have ties to Zaun?

Well, Noxus is a bit like Batman in that respect.  Batman always has a plan for how to take down everyone - even his closest friends.  Especially his closest friends.  Just because Batman hasn't taken you down, doesn't mean he's not given it a lot of thought.  (Also, mountains, Piltover's pretty fierce navy, risk/reward considerations, and wars on multiple fronts.)
